text: parameter chunks NULL (default) *companies dataset automatically chunked distribute companies across available cores. uses computer resources efficiently may enough. title: profile_emissions.Rmd
text: example defaults using toy datasets may use parameters file instead use data. Data specific indicator.
code: europages_companies <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$europages_companies)) ecoinvent_activities <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$ecoinvent_activities)) ecoinvent_europages <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$ecoinvent_europages)) isic <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$isic)) emissions_profile_any_companies <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$emissions_profile_any_companies)) # FIXME User toy_emissions_profile_products_ecoinvent() # See https://github.com/2DegreesInvesting/tiltToyData/pull/12 # https://github.com/2DegreesInvesting/tiltWorkflows/issues/9 emissions_profile_products <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$emissions_profile_products))

title: profile_emissions.Rmd
text: TILT indicator, compute results product company level.
code: emissions_profile <- profile_emissions(   companies = emissions_profile_any_companies,   co2 = emissions_profile_products,   europages_companies = europages_companies,   ecoinvent_activities = ecoinvent_activities,   ecoinvent_europages = ecoinvent_europages,   isic = isic ) #> Warning: Splitting `companies` into 4 chunks.

title: profile_emissions_upstream.Rmd
text: parameter chunks NULL (default) *companies dataset automatically chunked distribute companies across available cores. uses computer resources efficiently may enough. Consider adjusting chunks parameter manually. Aim balance memory-usage speed. small number chunks makes chunk bigger may overwhelm memory. large number chunks may take longer overhead caching chunk.
code: library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(readr, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(rappdirs) library(future) library(fs)  # Masking `tiltIndicatorAfter::profile*()` to use `chunks` library(tiltWorkflows) #> Loading required package: tiltIndicatorAfter #> Loading required package: tiltToyData #>  #> Attaching package: 'tiltWorkflows' #> The following objects are masked from $cache_dir #> [1] "" #>  #> $input #> [1] "input" #>  #> $output #> [1] "output" #>  #> $europages_companies #> [1] "europages_companies.csv" #>  #> $ecoinvent_activities #> [1] Determines the number of chunks   tiltWorkflows.chunks = params$chunks,   # Determines the order in which the chunks run   tiltWorkflows.order = params$order,   # Determines where to store the cache   tiltWorkflows.cache_dir = params$cache_dir,   # Read data quietly   readr.show_col_types = FALSE,   # Make printed output wider   width = 500 )  # Enable computing over multiple workers in parallel title: profile_emissions_upstream.Rmd
text: example defaults using toy datasets may use parameters file instead use data. “upstream” workflows also need dataset. Data specific indicator.
code: europages_companies <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$europages_companies)) ecoinvent_activities <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$ecoinvent_activities)) ecoinvent_europages <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$ecoinvent_europages)) isic <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$isic)) ecoinvent_inputs <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$ecoinvent_inputs)) emissions_profile_any_companies <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$emissions_profile_any_companies)) # FIXME User toy_emissions_profile_upstream_products_ecoinvent() # See https://github.com/2DegreesInvesting/tiltToyData/pull/12 # https://github.com/2DegreesInvesting/tiltWorkflows/issues/9 emissions_profile_upstream_products <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$emissions_profile_upstream_products))

title: profile_emissions_upstream.Rmd
text: TILT indicator, compute results product company level.
code: emissions_profile_upstream <- profile_emissions_upstream(   companies = emissions_profile_any_companies,   co2 = emissions_profile_upstream_products,   europages_companies = europages_companies,   ecoinvent_activities = ecoinvent_activities,   ecoinvent_inputs = ecoinvent_inputs,   ecoinvent_europages = ecoinvent_europages,   isic = isic ) #> Warning: Splitting `companies` into 4 chunks.

title: profile_sector.Rmd
text: parameter chunks NULL (default) *companies dataset automatically chunked distribute companies across available cores. uses computer resources efficiently may enough. Consider adjusting chunks parameter manually. Aim balance memory-usage speed. small number chunks makes chunk bigger may overwhelm memory. large number chunks may take longer overhead caching chunk.
code: library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(readr, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(rappdirs) library(future) library(fs)  # Masking `tiltIndicatorAfter::profile*()` to use `chunks` library(tiltWorkflows) #> Loading required package: tiltIndicatorAfter #> Loading required package: tiltToyData #>  #> Attaching package: 'tiltWorkflows' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:tiltIndicatorAfter': #>  #>     profile_emissions, profile_emissions_upstream, profile_sector, #>     profile_sector_upstream params #> $chunks #> [1] "" #>  #> $order #> [1] "sample" #>  #> $cache_dir #> [1] "" #>  #> $input #> [1] "input" #>  #> $output #> [1] "output" #>  #> $europages_companies #> [1] "europages_companies.csv" #>  #> $ecoinvent_activities #> [1] "ecoinvent_activities.csv" #>  #> $ecoinvent_europages #> [1] "ecoinvent_europages.csv" #>  #> $isic #> [1] "isic.csv" #>  #> $sector_profile_companies #> [1] "sector_profile_companies.csv" #>  #> $sector_profile_any_scenarios #> [1] "sector_profile_any_scenarios.csv" options(   # Determines the number of chunks   tiltWorkflows.chunks = params$chunks,   # Determines the order in which the chunks run   tiltWorkflows.order = params$order,   # Determines where to store the cache   tiltWorkflows.cache_dir = params$cache_dir,   # Read data quietly   readr.show_col_types = FALSE,   # Make printed output wider   width = 500 )  # Enable computing over multiple workers in parallel plan(multisession)  # Ensure input/ and output/ directories if (!dir_exists(params$input)) use_toy_input() if title: profile_sector.Rmd
text: example defaults using toy datasets may use parameters file instead use data. Data specific indicator.
code: europages_companies <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$europages_companies)) ecoinvent_activities <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$ecoinvent_activities)) ecoinvent_europages <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$ecoinvent_europages)) isic <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$isic)) sector_profile_companies <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$sector_profile_companies)) sector_profile_any_scenarios <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$sector_profile_any_scenarios))

title: profile_sector.Rmd
text: TILT indicator, compute results product company level.
code: sector_profile <- profile_sector(   companies = sector_profile_companies,   scenarios = sector_profile_any_scenarios,   europages_companies = europages_companies,   ecoinvent_activities = ecoinvent_activities,   ecoinvent_europages = ecoinvent_europages,   isic = isic ) #> Warning: Splitting `companies` into 4 chunks.

title: profile_sector_upstream.Rmd
text: parameter chunks NULL (default) *companies dataset automatically chunked distribute companies across available cores. uses computer resources efficiently may enough. Consider adjusting chunks parameter manually. Aim balance memory-usage speed. small number chunks makes chunk bigger may overwhelm memory. large number chunks may take longer overhead caching chunk.
code: library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(readr, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(rappdirs) library(future) library(fs)  # Masking `tiltIndicatorAfter::profile*()` to use `chunks` library(tiltWorkflows) #> Loading required package: tiltIndicatorAfter #> Loading required package: tiltToyData #>  #> Attaching package: 'tiltWorkflows' #> The following objects are masked from title: profile_sector_upstream.Rmd
text: example defaults using toy datasets may use parameters file instead use data. “upstream” workflows also need dataset. Data specific indicator.
code: europages_companies <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$europages_companies)) ecoinvent_activities <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$ecoinvent_activities)) ecoinvent_europages <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$ecoinvent_europages)) isic <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$isic)) ecoinvent_inputs <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$ecoinvent_inputs)) sector_profile_upstream_companies <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$sector_profile_upstream_companies)) sector_profile_any_scenarios <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$sector_profile_any_scenarios)) sector_profile_upstream_products <- read_csv(path(params$input, params$sector_profile_upstream_products))

title: profile_sector_upstream.Rmd

title: tiltWorkflows
text: workflow files may parameters header allow change behavior document without changing code. example, consider header: parameter element params list: workflow files use parameters many ways, example, create paths: can set parameters RStudio. Open document click “Knit Parameters …”:  Change defaults need click “Kint”.  Learn parametrized computational documents.
code: --- title: "tiltWorkflows" params:    output: "output"   file: "example.csv" --- params #> $output #> [1] "output" #>  #> $file #> [1] "example.csv" file.path(params$output, params$file) #> [1] "output/example.csv"

what: Handling large datasets and long run times
title: tiltWorkflows
text: tiltWorkflows package handles large *companies dataset splitting chunks fit computer’s memory, running multiple chunks parallel across multiple cores. entire process may still take long time, tiltWorkflows caches intermediate results can interrupt process point resume later without recomputing completed chunks. may enough , can still complete job faster. can run multiple processes complementary way interruption.

previous_headings: Handling large datasets and long run times
what: Running multiple processes in a complementary way
title: tiltWorkflows
text: Multiple processes can cooperate complete chunks faster possible single process. can twice faster two processes run workflow feed cache work chunks reverse order parameter order = 'rev'. can run workflow multiple processes number ways: Launch multiple instance RStudio click Knit. Write multiple .R files run background job RStudio: multiple instances Terminal use Rscript R expression: even faster results use parameter order = 'sample' run many processes want.
code: # job1.R rmarkdown::render('profile_emissions.Rmd')  # job2.R rmarkdown::render('profile_emissions.Rmd', params = list(order = 'rev')) # Terminal 1 Rscript -e "rmarkdown::render('profile_emissions.Rmd')"  # Terminal 2 Rscript -e "rmarkdown::render('profile_emissions.Rmd', params = list(order = 'rev'))"

previous_headings: Handling large datasets and long run times
title: tiltWorkflows
text: avoid interruptions can use remote computer. typically compute containers rocker/verse image running Docker droplet DigitalOcean. interactive work use RStudio container. non-interactive, long-running scripts use tmux: ssh terminal remote server, start tmux session, use many terminals necessary execute monitor jobs inside container.

what: Makes it Easy to Run TILT Workflows
title: Makes it Easy to Run TILT Workflows
text: goal tiltWorkflows make easy run tilt workflows. Main features: Easily access toy inputs try workflow. Easily access workflow file. Use data without writing code. Easily share reproducible report GitHub. Run large datasets normally saturate computer’s memory. Run faster normal running multiple chunks data parallel. Resume interruptions without recomputing completed chunks.

title: Makes it Easy to Run TILT Workflows
text: can install development version r-universe: GitHub: trouble? Try fresh new project https://posit.cloud/ (free).
code: options(repos = c("https://2degreesinvesting.r-universe.dev", getOption("repos"))) install.packages("tiltWorkflows") # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("2DegreesInvesting/tiltWorkflows")

title: tiltWorkflows 0.0.0.9033 (2024-04-03)
text: profile*() functions now throw warning using threshold arguments (@Tilmon #146). remind users default thresholds usually best, avoid changes mistake.

title: tiltWorkflows 0.0.0.9032 (2024-03-12)
text: workflow now uses default *thresholds (#141).

title: tiltWorkflows 0.0.0.9031 (2024-03-11)
text: profile*() now sensitive tiltIndicatorAfter_options (#135).

title: tiltWorkflows 0.0.0.9030 (2024-02-26)
text: profile*() functions gain argument isic deprecate argument isic_tilt, catch changes introduced tiltIndicatorAfter#112 (#130).

title: tiltWorkflows 0.0.0.9029 (2024-01-17)
text: Change license GPLv3 (#116).

title: tiltWorkflows 0.0.0.9028 (2023-12-21)
text: Ensure chunks numeric (#106).

title: tiltWorkflows 0.0.0.9027 (2023-12-21)
text: Remove needless toy files toy input/ directory (#103). files toy output included mistake.

title: tiltWorkflows 0.0.0.9026 (2023-12-21)
text: yaml setup change NULL empty string (#102). allows use GUI pops clicking “Knit Params” RStudio.

title: tiltWorkflows 0.0.0.9025 (2023-12-21)
text: New helpers handle cache (#98).

title: tiltWorkflows 0.0.0.9024 (2023-12-19)
text: Polish README extend Get started (#87).

title: tiltWorkflows 0.0.0.9023 (2023-12-19)
text: Reexport rmarkdown::render() (#88).

title: tiltWorkflows 0.0.0.9022 (2023-12-18)
text: cache_dir now parameter (#84). default ’s rappdirs::user_cache_dir("tiltWorkflows").

title: tiltWorkflows 0.0.0.9021 (2023-12-18)
text: Allow run chunks different order (#78).

title: tiltWorkflows 0.0.0.9020 (2023-12-16)
text: workflows parameter chunks now defaults NULL, automatically sets reasonable number chunks (#74).

title: tiltWorkflows 0.0.0.9019 (2023-12-15)
text: Add installation instructions r-universe point [posit.cloud])(https://posit.cloud/) (@AnneSchoenauer #67). Import packages user needs render workflows (#68).

title: tiltWorkflows 0.0.0.9018 (2023-12-15)
text: workflow, section now explanation.

title: tiltWorkflows 0.0.0.9017 (2023-12-15)
text: Explain indicator results sections (@Tilmon #65).

title: tiltWorkflows 0.0.0.9016 (2023-12-15)
text: Document knitting workflow runs code creates results (@Tilmon #59).

title: tiltWorkflows 0.0.0.9015 (2023-12-15)
text: Show results readers expect : Results (@Tilmon #60).

title: tiltWorkflows 0.0.0.9014 (2023-12-14)
text: Remove read_csv_falling_back_to() without deprecation (#45). function internal, package still exposed users.

title: tiltWorkflows 0.0.0.9013 (2023-12-14)
text: Default expecting input/ output/ working directory (#41)

title: tiltWorkflows 0.0.0.9012 (2023-12-14)
text: New use_toy_input() helps users get toy input/ .csv files (#42).

title: tiltWorkflows 0.0.0.9011 (2023-12-14)
text: use_workflow() template now throws helpful error message makes workflows() unnecessary (#39). Thus, workflow() becomes internal retired public API without deprecation since package still experimental users.

title: tiltWorkflows 0.0.0.9010 (2023-12-14)
text: workflow files now output github_document (#30). makes easy user share output GitHub.

title: tiltWorkflows 0.0.0.9009 (2023-12-13)
text: use_workflow() now automatically opens workflow file interactive sessions (#21).

title: tiltWorkflows 0.0.0.9008 (2023-12-13)
text: Workflows now split indicator, run chunks (#20). split indicator allows user granular control want run. computations chunk run parallel caching intermediate results, process completes faster, saves memory, allows resuming interruptions.

title: tiltWorkflows 0.0.0.9007 (2023-12-08)
text: Parametrize workflow tilt-profiles.Rmd (#14). helps users pass data via graphical user interface, without changing code.

title: tiltWorkflows 0.0.0.9006 (2023-12-08)
text: workflow “tilt profiles” now reproducible toy data (#6).

title: tiltWorkflows 0.0.0.9005 (2023-12-08)
text: New article: Use parameters (#12).

title: tiltWorkflows 0.0.0.9004 (2023-12-07)
text: Depend tiltToyData (#8). makes toy datasets available user automatically call library(tiltWorkflows).

title: tiltWorkflows 0.0.0.9003 (2023-12-07)
text: Depend tiltIndicatorAfter (#7). makes tiltWorkflows user friendly since ’s package users need install use – everything else happens behind hoods.

title: tiltWorkflows 0.0.0.9002 (2023-12-07)
text: New use_workflow() helps users create workflow file template (#5).

title: tiltWorkflows 0.0.0.9001 (2023-12-06)
text: New article “Get started” (#4 @kalashsinghal).
